title: Fed chair Jerome Powell hints at further rate cuts and moves to stop cash crunch
text:
The US Federal Reserve has confirmed its openness to further rate cuts while adding it will begin expanding its balance sheet in response to recent unexpected funding issues.

Chairman Jerome Powell appeared to confirm market expectations of a 25 basis-point cut at its October meeting on Tuesday night, stating the Fed will “act as appropriate to support continued growth, a strong job market, and inflation moving back to our symmetric 2pc objective”.

The Fed has already reduced its benchmark rate twice this year and is expected to approve a third cut later this month.
